definition: lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
surname Gong
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis

sentences.english: The Fed seems to have been spooked, and wanted to stop the markets' fall (see article).
sentences.chinese: 美聯儲似乎像是驚弓之鳥，妄圖阻止股市的下跌。

sentences.english: The surge in gold is a sign of how jittery investors have become.
sentences.chinese: 金價急升，顯出投資者已是驚弓之鳥。

sentences.english: Now capitalism is in a funk in its heartlands.
sentences.chinese: 現在資本主義的國家有如驚弓之鳥。

sentences.english: Puma bow-string such as iron, said he was also cant afford it.
sentences.chinese: 鐵彪如驚弓之鳥，說自己實在還不起。
他們已經成了驚弓之鳥。

definition: to obstruct/to impede
doddering/senile
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
clan/race
grand dreams/unrealistic ideas (idiom)
lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
resentment and indignation
sudden thrust (that catches the opponent off guard)
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
hegemonism
in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
